post.description:
Create a Cart. Although optional, specifying the cart's region and sales channel can affect the cart's pricing and
the products that can be added to the cart respectively. So, make sure to set those early on and change them if necessary, such as when the customer changes their region.

If a customer is logged in, make sure to pass its ID or email within the cart's details so that the cart is attached to the customer.

post.description:
Complete a cart and place an order or create a swap, based on the cart's type. This includes attempting to authorize the cart's payment.
If authorizing the payment requires more action, the cart will not be completed and the order will not be placed or the swap will not be created.

An idempotency key will be generated if none is provided in the header `Idempotency-Key` and added to
the response. If an error occurs during cart completion or the request is interrupted for any reason, the cart completion can be retried by passing the idempotency
key in the `Idempotency-Key` header.

parameters.description: The Cart ID.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of products. The products can be filtered by fields such as `id` or `q`. The products can also be sorted or paginated.
This API Route can also be used to retrieve a product by its handle.

For accurate and correct pricing of the products based on the customer's context, it's highly recommended to pass fields such as
`region_id`, `currency_code`, and `cart_id` when available.

Passing `sales_channel_id` ensures retrieving only products available in the specified sales channel.
You can alternatively use a publishable API key in the request header instead of passing a `sales_channel_id`.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: term used to search products' title, description, variant's title, variant's sku, and collection's title.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by IDs.

parameters.name: sales_channel_id
parameters.description: Filter by sales channel IDs. When provided, only products available in the selected sales channels are retrieved. Alternatively, you can pass a publishable API key in the request header and this will have the same effect.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Filter by product collection IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product collections are retrieved.

parameters.name: type_id
parameters.description: Filter by product type IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product types are retrieved.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by product tag IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product tags are retrieved.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter by title.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter by description

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Filter by handle.

parameters.name: is_giftcard
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve regular products or gift-card products.

parameters.name: lt
parameters.description: filter by dates less than this date

parameters.name: gt
parameters.description: filter by dates greater than this date

parameters.name: lte
parameters.description: filter by dates less than or equal to this date

parameters.name: gte
parameters.description: filter by dates greater than or equal to this date

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: Filter by product category IDs. When provided, only products that belong to the specified product categories are retrieved.

parameters.name: include_category_children
parameters.description: Whether to include child product categories when filtering using the `category_id` field.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of products to skip when retrieving the products.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of products returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Comma-separated relations that should be expanded in the returned products.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields that should be included in the returned products.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: A product field to sort-order the retrieved products by.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The ID of the cart. This is useful for accurate pricing based on the cart's context.

parameters.name: region_id
parameters.description: The ID of the region. This is useful for accurate pricing based on the selected region.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: A 3 character ISO currency code. This is useful for accurate pricing based on the selected currency.

For accurate and correct pricing of the product variants based on the customer's context, it's highly recommended to pass fields such as

Create a Swap for an Order. This will also create a return and associate it with the swap. If a return shipping option is specified, the return will automatically be fulfilled.
To complete the swap, you must use the Complete Cart API Route passing it the ID of the swap's cart.

An idempotency key will be generated if none is provided in the header `Idempotency-Key` and added to
the response. If an error occurs during swap creation or the request is interrupted for any reason, the swap creation can be retried by passing the idempotency
key in the `Idempotency-Key` header.

get.description: Retrieve a list of products. The products can be filtered by fields such as `q` or `status`. The products can also be sorted or paginated.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: term to search products' title, description, variants' title and sku, and collections' title.

parameters.name: discount_condition_id
parameters.description: Filter by the ID of a discount condition. Only products that this discount condition is applied to will be retrieved.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter by product IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Filter by product collection IDs. Only products that are associated with the specified collections will be retrieved.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by product tag IDs. Only products that are associated with the specified tags will be retrieved.

parameters.name: price_list_id
parameters.description: Filter by IDs of price lists. Only products that these price lists are applied to will be retrieved.

parameters.name: sales_channel_id
parameters.description: Filter by sales channel IDs. Only products that are available in the specified sales channels will be retrieved.

parameters.name: type_id
parameters.description: Filter by product type IDs. Only products that are associated with the specified types will be retrieved.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: Filter by product category IDs. Only products that are associated with the specified categories will be retrieved.

parameters.name: include_category_children
parameters.description: whether to include product category children when filtering by `category_id`

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter by title.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter by description.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Filter by handle.

parameters.name: is_giftcard
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve gift cards or regular products.

parameters.name: lt
parameters.description: filter by dates less than this date

parameters.name: gt
parameters.description: filter by dates greater than this date

parameters.name: lte
parameters.description: filter by dates less than or equal to this date

parameters.name: gte
parameters.description: filter by dates greater than or equal to this date

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of products to skip when retrieving the products.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of products returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Comma-separated relations that should be expanded in the returned products.

parameters.description: Comma-separated fields that should be included in the returned products.

code.description: A unique code that will be used to redeem the discount

is_dynamic.description: Whether the discount should have multiple instances of itself, each with a different code. This can be useful for automatically generated discount codes that all have to follow a common set of rules.

is_disabled.description: Whether the discount code is disabled on creation. If set to `true`, it will not be available for customers.

starts_at.description: The date and time at which the discount should be available.

ends_at.description: The date and time at which the discount should no longer be available.

valid_duration.description: The duration the discount runs between

usage_limit.description: Maximum number of times the discount can be used

regions.description: A list of region IDs representing the Regions in which the Discount can be used.

metadata.description: An optional set of key-value pairs to hold additional information.

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

rule.description: The discount rule that defines how discounts are calculated

description.description: A short description of the discount

value.description: The value that the discount represents. This will depend on the type of the discount.

type.description: The type of the discount, can be `fixed` for discounts that reduce the price by a fixed amount, `percentage` for percentage reductions or `free_shipping` for shipping vouchers.

allocation.description: The scope that the discount should apply to. `total` indicates that the discount should be applied on the cart total, and `item` indicates that the discount should be applied to each discountable item in the cart.

conditions.description: A set of conditions that can be used to limit when the discount can be used. Only one of `products`, `product_types`, `product_collections`, `product_tags`, and `customer_groups` should be provided based on the discount condition's type.

operator.description: Operator of the condition. `in` indicates that discountable resources are within the specified resources. `not_in` indicates that discountable resources are everything but the specified resources.

products.description: list of product IDs if the condition's type is `products`.

product_types.description: list of product type IDs if the condition's type is `product_types`.

product_collections.description: list of product collection IDs if the condition's type is `product_collections`.

product_tags.description: list of product tag IDs if the condition's type is `product_tags`.

customer_groups.description: list of customer group IDs if the condition's type is `customer_groups`.

email.description: The Customer's email. You can't update the email of a registered customer.

metadata.description: An optional set of key-value pairs to hold additional information.

externalDocs.description: Learn about the metadata attribute, and how to delete and update it.

groups.description: A list of customer groups to which the customer belongs.

ends_at.description: The date and time at which the discount should no longer be available.

valid_duration.description: The duration the discount runs between

usage_limit.description: Maximum number of times the discount can be used

regions.description: A list of region IDs representing the Regions in which the Discount can be used.

DraftOrder.title: DraftOrder
DraftOrder.description: A draft order is created by an admin without direct involvement of the customer. Once its payment is marked as captured, it is transformed into an order.

ShippingProfile.title: Shipping Profile
ShippingProfile.description: A Shipping Profile has a set of defined Shipping Options that can be used to fulfill a given set of Products. For example, gift cards are shipped differently than physical products, so a shipping profile with the type `gift_card` groups together the shipping options that can only be used for gift cards.

PaymentProvider.title: Payment Provider
PaymentProvider.description: A payment provider represents a payment service installed in the Medusa backend, either through a plugin or backend customizations. It holds the payment service's installation status.

id.description: The ID of the payment provider as given by the payment service.

is_installed.description: Whether the payment service is installed in the current version. If a payment service is no longer installed, the `is_installed` attribute is set to `false`.

payment_providers.description: An array of payment providers details.

TaxProvider.title: Tax Provider
TaxProvider.description: A tax provider represents a tax service installed in the Medusa backend, either through a plugin or backend customizations. It holds the tax service's installation status.

id.description: The ID of the tax provider as given by the tax service.

is_installed.description: Whether the tax service is installed in the current version. If a tax service is no longer installed, the `is_installed` attribute is set to `false`.

tax_providers.description: An array of tax providers details.
